channel.title: Why?
channel.description: I don't get it, everyone says when you host a RSPS, you need to make a separate client for your self, and with the default ip, however I'm hosting my RSPS with no-ip on my own computer as well as for others. And it's working...?

item.title: Why?
item.dc:creator: @iHype iHype
item.description:
@iHype wrote:

DannY Boii:

I don’t get it, everyone says when you host a RSPS, you need to make a separate client for your self, and with the default ip, however I’m hosting my RSPS with no-ip on my own computer as well as for others. And it’s working…?

wat.

Read full topic

item.title: Why?
item.dc:creator: @Skizard Skizard
item.description:
@Skizard wrote:

I’m not sure what you mean but I always keep a backup of my source and client so if I mess something up it’s not the end of the world as I can just correct it with my backup.
